nodes.text: The Mission to Ord Radama took place during the Galactic Civil War on the planet Ord Radama.

After the Battle of the Gauntlet, which saw the destruction of their base on Arda I, the Rebels settled on a new base on Jagomir. There, Var Narek was exposed as an Imperial spy and a traitor to the Alliance. He consecutively kidnapped Senior Advisor Setenna Hase, a valuable Alliance leader, and fled the planet aboard a JumpMaster 5000 to reach Ord Radama's capital city of Livien Magnus so that she could be interrogated by Imperial Intelligence.

Fortunately for the Rebels, due to the anomalies of the Jaga's Cluster, the journey from Jagomir to Ord Radama took approximately two days. In order to catch up to Narek, the Rebels used a little-known route given by Commander Danel Qurno which shaved half a day from the trip.

However, this route wasn't without problems as it had its own travel hazards and intersected with the Daragon Trail, a heavily patrolled Imperial hyperspace lane. The Rebels exited from Jagomir and embarked in a series of hyperspace jumps. They took along a circuitous path through the Lorattick Nebula and dangerously close to XV-344H, a red dwarf star. The last part of their trip was along the Daragon Trail, which was patrolled by the Interdictor-class Star Destroyer Eternal Wrath. They successfully avoided the Star Destroyer and landed safely on Ord Radama.

The Rebels arrived on Ord Radama before Narek and first went to the Livien Magnus spaceport. There, the officials of the Ord Radama Spaceport Authority revealed that no JumpMaster 5000 had docked in the past two days, confirming that Narek had not yet reached the planet.

It is possible for players to run into the Interdictor-class Star Destroyer Eternal Wrath on their journey along the Daragon Trail, but only if they fail to make a specified course correction. If they do, they must persuade the ship's crew to let them pass despite having outdated access codes, otherwise Captain Wellam Adarios calls for them to be brought aboard for questioning and sends TIE fighters to destroy them if they try to escape. This article assumes that players were successful and so did not encounter the Star Destroyer.
